thread.title: Troy Deeney threatened with pepper spray by police - but Watford not expected to take action against captain
thread.title_full: Troy Deeney threatened with pepper spray by police - but Watford not expected to take action against captain

author: Mike Walters
title: Troy Deeney threatened with pepper spray by police - but Watford not expected to take action against captain
text:
Troy Deeney in action with Paul Pogba and Eric Bailly (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Watford are not expected to take any action against Troy Deeney after the Hornets captain was threatened with pepper spray outside a Birmingham nightclub. 
Deeney is understood to have been punched inside the Levana Bar after turning down a punter's persistent requests for a photograph. 
He was among several people thrown out of the club by bouncers and a WPC brandished a pepper spray canister inches from his face when he was being told to calm down by officers outside. 
Mirror Sport understands Deeney, 28, briefed club officials at Vicarage Road early on Sunday morning about the incident and they are fully aware of the sequence of events, but they will not be issuing a statement. Troy Deeney shoots at goal (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Deeney argues with Etienne Capoue (Photo: Richard Heathcote) 
Watford's seven-goal top scorer had been enjoying a night out with pals in his home city hours after the 2-0 defeat at Manchester United. 
Deeney served three months of a 10-month jail term in 2012 after admitting affray after he was involved in a brawl in Birmingham city centre. 
His 103 goals for Watford in six seasons, took him to the brink of an England call-up last year. 
And the Hornets rejected three bids from champions Leicester, rising to £30 million, for their captain last summer before he signed a new five-year contract worth around £60,000-a-week. Like us on Facebook
